intro: Hieracium purpurifolium, commonly known as the purple leaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers with a distinctive purple-tinged leaf structure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the stems are hairy and erect. Hieracium purpurifolium thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
